description.plain:
Darold D. Brown Ferguson, Jr. (born October 20, 1988), better known by his stage name A$AP Ferg, is an American rapper from New York City’s Harlem neighborhood. Aside from his solo career, he is a member of the hip hop collective A$AP Mob.

Born as Darold Ferguson Jr., named after his father the late Darold Ferguson Sr, Ferg was raised in a northern neighborhood located in Harlem, New York known as Hamilton Heights or The Hungry Ham. See Ferg talk about it more on Complex’s “The Neighborhood”:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UCovnI_dwuQ

Darold pursued fashion at first. Starting a clothing line known as Devoni Clothing he designed and distributed high-end belts worn by Chris Brown, Swizz Beatz, and Diggy Simmons.  According to Frank151 he told fellow A$AP Mob member and childhood friend A$AP Rocky:

You do the rapping thing and I’ll catch up when the time is right

Around 2009 he began making music with his friends and music associates.  He explains on his site:

I went from painting to making clothes to rapping. I always put myself into everything I do one hundred percent. It doesn’t matter what I’m working on. I want to perfect everything I do. Success is the only option. They call me ‘Trap Lord’ because my hustle game is impeccable

On August 20, 2013, Ferg released his debut album Trap Lord met with generally positive reviews.

description.plain: A$AP Ferg brought together an ensemble cast for the official remix of his song, “Work,” which was featured on the August 2012 A$AP Mob mixtape, Lord$ Never Worry. The trap anthem sees each artist rapping about their difficult upbringings and the hard work they put in to get to where they are now.

description.plain:
After “East Coast REMIX,” “Work REMIX,” and “Shabba REMIX,” A$AP Ferg comes through with yet another remix of one of his popular songs. This time, rap superstar Nicki Minaj hops on “Plain Jane REMIX,” marking the first time she collaborates with the New York native.

The Trinidad MC flips several lines from the original version, including a new chorus:

Ride with Minaj, mmh Mashallah
Check in with me, then do your job
Queen is the name, Rafaello did the chain
This is Monse, patty Plain Jane

The song was released on the 15th of December 2017 across all digital platforms.

songs.full_title: Plain Jane by A$AP Ferg
songs.title: Plain Jane

description.plain:
“Plain Jane” details Ferg’s love for “plain jane” watches and talks about his childhood. It was originally released under his EP Furious Ferg and eventually became the lead single for Still Striving.

The track’s flow and instrumental are heavily influenced by the 1999 cult-classic “Slob on My Knob” by Tear Da Club Up Thugs—a side project of Three 6 Mafia.

The music video opens with a new verse by Juicy J, who did the original track. Before he can finish, he’s abruptly cut off and  the next scene shows Ferg surrounded by a crew of BMX bike riders, outside some housing projects.

“Plain Jane” proved to be more successful than planned, peaking at #26 on the Billboard Hot 100 and going platinum in eight months.

A remix of the song was released on December 15, 2017 and  featured Young Money’s own Nicki Minaj.

songs.full_title: Shabba by A$AP Ferg (Ft. A$AP Rocky)
songs.title: Shabba

description.plain:
A$AP Ferg and affiliate A$AP Rocky team up for an ode to Jamaican dancehall legend Shabba Ranks, on the lead single for Ferg’s debut album, Trap Lord.

Over a sinister Snugsworth beat, Ferg and Rocky trade bars about their sexual endeavors and compare their exotic lifestyles to the legendary Emperor Ranks. The song was successful—reaching platinum certification by the RIAA on November 8, 2019, and peaked at #44 on the Billboard Hot 100 on August 3, 2013.

Accompanying visuals were released on July 15, 2013, and feature the two rappers enjoying a luxurious party in a mansion, along with multiple other A$AP Mob members. Shabba Ranks also has a brief cameo in the music video.

Four months later, on November 23, 2013, a remix was released, which boasted a feature from Shabba Ranks himself, along with Migos and Busta Rhymes.

songs.full_title: New Level by A$AP Ferg (Ft. Future)
songs.title: New Level

description.plain:
“New Level” is A$AP Ferg’s newest banger, featuring him and Future trading verses. The pair has collaborated before on Juicy J’s “Ice”, and, as Future teased on Instagram, Ferg directed his forthcoming video for DS2 opening cut “Thought It Was A Drought.”

“New Level” premiered on Hot 97 DJ Ebro Darden’s Beats 1 radio show on December 17, 2015 as the second single off his sophomore album, Always Strive and Prosper.

https://youtu.be/Srns7NiO278

Behind the scenes



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ngkHig8H_88

The 7th track from A$AP Ferg’s debut, Trap Lord. Here, Ferg talks about stealing another man’s girl; an act he really does not need to do given he is quite the ladies man.



While it is not that clear as to what “dump dump” is supposed to mean, Ferg has used it previously on Shabba in reference to a semi-automatic “dumping” its clip in order to reload.

songs.full_title: Lord by A$AP Ferg (Ft. Bone Thugs-N-Harmony)
songs.title: Lord

description.plain:
“Lord” is track 3 of A$AP Ferg’s debut album Trap Lord. The track features the legendary hip-hop group Bone Thugs-n-Harmony, and the mystical, dark beat is produced Crystal Caines & Ozhora Miyagi.

Everyone delivers a solid verse, especially Bone Thugs-n-Harmony with their incredible speed and flow. It’s safe to call this track a successful posse-cut.

songs.full_title: Murda Something by A$AP Ferg (Ft. Waka Flocka Flame)
songs.title: Murda Something

description.plain: Murda Something is the 10th track off of Trap Lord. The track features Wacka Flocka Flame, it is produced by Finatik N Zac, Jim Jonsin and Rico  Love. The song is written by Darold Brown, Nikolas Marzouca, Michael Mule, James Scheffer, Isaac de Boni, Rico Love, and Juaquin Malphers. The song details how both A$AP Ferg and Waka Flocka Flame are willing to murder people and fornicate with the late gangster’s significant other. It insinuates that the gangster lifestyle is good for Flocka and Ferg, but if someone is enemies with those two, the results could be dreadful for their enemy. Ferg and Flocka use language that some would consider foul in order to portray how crazy they can be when pushed.

songs.full_title: Move Ya Hips by A$AP Ferg (Ft. MadeinTYO & Nicki Minaj)
songs.title: Move Ya Hips
songs.title_with_featured: Move Ya Hips (Ft. MadeinTYO & Nicki Minaj)

description.plain:
“Move Ya Hips” is a collaboration between A$AP Mob member A$AP Ferg, rap veteran Nicki Minaj and Atlanta rapper MadeinTYO.

Sonically, a light-sounding, sparkly trap beat sets the stage for MadeinTYO’s repetitive but catchy chorus. Heavier drums and bass are then brought into the two verses by New York natives Ferg and Nicki. The pair flow effortlessly, exchanging braggadocios bars packed full of wordplay. Minaj also adopts her quintessential formula of switching from a deep, low-octave voice to a much higher-pitched girly sounding vocal.

  


The song was first previewed by DJ Clue via Instagram Live on May 11, 2020. Nicki tweeted to fans, telling them to “light up Ferg’s comments everyday” if they wanted it to drop. Rapper and A$AP Mob member A$AP Rocky also co-signed the demand on July 26, which would precede Ferg’s official announcement about its imminent release less than 24 hours later.

This marks Ferg’s third collaboration with Nicki, with  the first two being 2017’s “Plain Jane REMIX” and the 2018’s “Runnin” for Creed II’s soundtrack. While also marking the fifth appearance with MadeinTYO—on “One Night Savage,” “Square Bitch,” “WAM” and their 2018 hit, “Ned Flanders.”

songs.title: Mattress REMIX
songs.title_with_featured: Mattress REMIX (Ft. A$AP Rocky, Famous Dex, Playboi Carti & Rich The Kid)

description.plain:
A$AP Ferg teams up with friend and collaborator A$AP Rocky for a standout remix, accompanied by an electric back-and-forth from the Rich Forever duo Famous Dex and Rich The Kid and contributions from AWGE affiliate Playboi Carti, fresh off of his debut mixtape.

Though the track is a remix, it was released before the original The Mattress, which later surfaced on A$AP Ferg’s YouTube channel with an accompanying music video in November of 2017.

songs.full_title: Let It Bang by A$AP Ferg (Ft. ScHoolboy Q)
songs.title: Let It Bang

description.plain:
“Let It Bang” is the follow-up to another banger, Ferg’s Future-assisted single “New Level,” Both tracks appear on his sophomore album, Always Strive And Prosper.

On “Let It Bang,” Ferg details the life and times of his uncle Psycho, a reckless troublemaker and one-time role model.

Ferg also talks about Psycho on “Uncle,” off his 2014 mixtape, Ferg Forever. “Psycho,” the track before this, is also about his uncle, and as Ferg told in a interview:

When you listen to “Psycho” and “Let It Bang,” it’s like one song all the way through.

description.plain:
“Floor Seats” is yet another single from A$AP Ferg, after “Wigs,” “Pups,” and “Wam,” released in anticipation of his new project under the same title – Floor Seats.

The single was welcomed on July 18, 2019, along with the official music video from the Trap Lord himself:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2U-vrd6JhBY

The song samples “Smack My Bitch Up” by The Prodigy.

songs.full_title: Mad Man by A$AP Ferg (Ft. Playboi Carti)
songs.title: Mad Man

description.plain:
A$AP Ferg continues his strong lineup of features with the up and coming rapper Playboi Carti. The song is a diss towards the Raider Klan from past beef between them and A$AP Mob. Whether the beef towards current members or past members, the targeted diss is towards SpaceGhostPurrp and his friend Jitt, who is mentioned in the intro.

The song uses two samples from the Three 6 Mafia, “Playa Hataz” and “Tear da Club Up”.

Before its release, a demo version of the song was auctioned by Music Mafia. It leaked on December 10, 2017.

songs.full_title: Trap And A Dream by A$AP Ferg (Ft. Meek Mill)
songs.title: Trap And A Dream
songs.title_with_featured: Trap And A Dream (Ft. Meek Mill)

description.plain:
Reflecting back to when he sold drugs, Ferg admits his larger aspirations to be a successful rapper.

The words dream and trap can be seen as commentary on the dual natural of trapping, being dangerously unappealing while economically appealing. Selling drugs can make dealers trapped in their corner of income, while at the same time earning them hard cold cash.

Being the “Traplord” that he is, A$AP Ferg introduces us to this album with a homage to trapping – fitting for the title Still Striving.

songs.full_title: Jet Lag by A$AP Ferg
songs.title: Jet Lag

description.plain:
“Jet Lag” is the second song on A$AP Ferg’s August 2019 album Floor Seats.

On the song, Ferg elaborates on the superstar lifestyle that he lives and on his sexual endeavors. The rapper also alludes to older songs of his, such as “New Level” and “Plain Jane.”

A$AP Ferg previewed the song a few hours before the release of Floor Seats, sharing a video of him vibing to the song in the studio.

songs.title_with_featured: Yammy Gang (Ft. A$AP Mob & Tatianna Paulino)

description.plain:
The A$AP Mob comes together on this track to spit bars and commemorate the late A$AP Yams, the founder of the mob.

The track fits closely to Yams' style (found throughout Trap Lord, Ferg’s debut album) and is continuing Yams' creative legacy.

Yams' mother, Tatiana Paulino appears at the end of the track to say just this.



The official music video, featuring A$AP Mob, was dropped May 26th 2016:

body.plain:
The A$AP Mob comes together on this track to spit bars and commemorate the late A$AP Yams, the founder of the mob.

The track fits closely to Yams' style (found throughout Trap Lord, Ferg’s debut album) and is continuing Yams' creative legacy.

Yams' mother, Tatiana Paulino appears at the end of the track to say just this.



The official music video, featuring A$AP Mob, was dropped May 26th 2016:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MQvb_oGWzgk

songs.full_title: Psycho by A$AP Ferg
songs.title: Psycho

description.plain:
“Psycho” continues the story of Ferg’s uncle introduced in “Meet My Crazy Uncle (Skit)”.

Ferg works to paint a picture of his uncle both physically and mentally, and portrays Psycho as someone who is never sober and always finding trouble or something to hustle in the ghetto.



Ferg posted that artwork on his Instagram among others.

description.plain:
Nearly a year after dropping the original single with Future, Ferg adds Lil Uzi Vert and A$AP Rocky to the song’s roster for a remix.

The track comes only days after news of the completion of the first A$AP Mob joint project, Cozy Tapes, Vol. 1: Friends. The remix was announced on Twitter by both Rocky and Ferg as a birthday present to fans for Ferg’s birthday.

songs.full_title: East Coast by A$AP Ferg (Ft. Remy Ma)
songs.title: East Coast

description.plain:
Harlem-native A$AP Ferg grabs Bronx’s own Remy Ma to make the east coast proud in this promotional single for Ferg’s second mixtape, Still Striving. This is the two rapper’s first collaboration, but they both came with the hard bars. Ferg claims the title as ‘Mr. East Coast’ and Remy throws some possible shots at Nicki Minaj on her verse.

“East Coast” first premiered on Apple Music’s Beats 1 Radio on April 6, 2017, at 7:30 PM EST along with an interview with Ferg given by Ebro Darden, it was simultaneously posted on most streaming services, dropping on Tidal in an exclusive playlist curated by the Harlem rapper.

With the release of Still Striving on August 18, 2017, “East Coast” was not featured on the album, but the “East Coast REMIX” was featured on the album. The remix did not feature Remy Ma, instead featuring east coast rappers Rick Ross, French Montana, Dave East, A$AP Rocky, and Busta Rhymes. The remix also featured a new verse from Ferg, as well as a verse from west coast rapper Snoop Dogg.

In the video for “East Coast,” Ferg and Remy Ma rap in several locales, including a church, a hotel room, and a green-lit hallway. The video pays homage to DMX’s video for “What’s My Name” as well as Busta Rhyme’s video for “Dangerous.” Ferg confirms he channeled classic NY vibes in an interview with Billboard. Rick Ross, A$AP Rocky, and French Montana make appearances as well.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HXBf0mvF6F4

New York’s A$AP Ferg and Detroit’s Big Sean show their vulnerable sides on the “World Is Mine.”

The song is the third single off A$AP Ferg’s second album Always Strive and Prosper.

The last time A$AP Ferg and Big Sean teamed up was in 2015, on Meek Mill’s “B Boy,” and before that they teamed up to pay tribute to a legend 2014’s “Ja Rule.”

songs.full_title: Nandos by A$AP Ferg
songs.title: Nandos

description.plain:
Nando’s is a South African food chain that is also widely popular in the UK, Australia, and growing worldwide. It is famous for its delicious Peri Peri chicken. While Nandos only appears once in the song, it pertains to the theme – particularly in the second verse – of simply eating, and celebrating the fact that the squad aren’t going hungry:
24/7 on the corner all my niggas they be all survivin'
Used to hear ice cream trucks now all we hear is sirens
That’s ‘cause this fucking world only stuck on money and violence
Ferg is at once lamenting the changes he’s seen in his lifetime – touching on police brutality, those 'in the blues’ that continue to criminalize the black body – and proudly proclaiming the success he’s achieved, from Lambos to Nando’s.

songs.full_title: Dennis Rodman by A$AP Ferg (Ft. Tyga)
songs.title: Dennis Rodman

description.plain:
Another song aptly titled after the person it pays homage to, this party-banger is filled with references to NBA legend Dennis Rodman. Dennis Rodman was known for being a force both on and off of the court. Rodman is by far the most “out-there” NBA player ever, with antics like marrying himself, befriending Kim Jong-Un and appearing on WCW Monday Nitro as a wrestler. Ferg draws comparisons between his lifestyle and Rodman’s, along with the help of Tyga.

This isn’t the first time Dennis Rodman has been mentioned in Hip-hop; Other artists such as Lil Wayne’s “A Milli” , Rich Homie Quan’s “Flex (Ooh, Ooh, Ooh)” ,  DaBaby’s Rockstar , and alternative Hip-Hop/R&B supergroup Mansionz’s Dennis Rodman have given him shout outs. In fact, the latter features Rodman himself in the outro.

songs.title: Kristi
songs.title_with_featured: Kristi (Ft. Denzel Curry, IDK & Nick Nack)

description.plain:
A$AP Ferg Has dropped an unannounced braggadocious single with his “Mad Man Tour” mates: IDK and Denzel Curry.

The song title is in reference to Kristi Yamaguchi, a former two-time World Champion American figure skater.

Alluding to the latter-half of her last name which is a homonym of Gucci, the Italian luxury brand of fashion and leather goods.

A$AP Ferg Has dropped an unannounced braggadocious single with his “Mad Man Tour” mates: IDK and Denzel Curry.

The song title is in reference to Kristi Yamaguchi, a former two-time World Champion American figure skater.

Alluding to the latter-half of her last name which is a homonym of Gucci, the Italian luxury brand of fashion and leather goods.

songs.full_title: Let You Go by A$AP Ferg
songs.title: Let You Go

description.plain:
A$AP Ferg said this album—Always Strive and Propser—was his most personal album to date (it’s his sophomore album).  At the listening party for this song, he said:

I lost a girlfriend over this. The dream had to come first. You might not get another album like this from me. I sacrificed a girl for art.

Ferg spits this song from his girlfriend’s perspective, acknowledging his struggle between being honest in his art and maintaining his personal relationships. Ferg’s following the tropes of a rapper who’s career is blowing up, similar to Jay Z’s “Song Cry,” which he references in the second verse. While Ferg laments his illicit behavior, he doesn’t fully regret it—rather, he accepts it as a necessary evil, and part of what it means to be an honest artist.

The Norwegian production duo StarGate produced this track. They’ve been enjoying mainstream success in the U.S. since producing Ne-Yo’s 2006 #1 hit “So Sick,” and have since worked with major stars including Beyoncé, Rihanna, Jennifer Hudson and more.

songs.full_title: Strive by A$AP Ferg (Ft. Missy Elliott)
songs.title: Strive

description.plain:
“Strive,” A$AP Ferg’s collaboration with Missy Elliott, is a single from Ferg’s sophomore album Always Strive And Prosper. The song is about making the most of your opportunities to be great. Both Ferg and Missy recall growing up and how they were inspired by their family members to pursue their dreams.

In an interview with XXL, Ferg recalled the making of the song:


When I created “Strive” with Missy, I was in that mode of music. I was like, “Yo, why I can’t I make house music? I want to make house music. I want to rap over house beats,” and I did a bunch of songs before the Missy song, you know developing the style.
The Missy song was the product that came out of it.

That whole time I was trying to create that sound. Missy gravitated to the record because she just loved the song but I didn’t even plan for her to be on it. I was playing her the record because you know I like the song. I had two verses on there and I took out my second verse to put her on there. Originally it was just going to be me on the song, so that was the type of music and the space I was in creatively.
